text: Then girded David his sword upon his raiment, and began to go: for he never proved it: and David said unto Saul, I can not go with these: for I am not accustomed. Wherefore David put them off him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then took he his staff in his hand, and chose him five smooth stones out of a brook, and put them in his shepherd’s bag or scrip, and his sling was in his hand, and he drew near to the Philistine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Philistine came and drew near unto David, and the man that bare the shield went before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the Philistine looked about and saw David, he disdained him: for he was but young, ruddy, and of a comely face.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Philistine said unto David, Am I a dog, that thou comest to me with staves? And the Philistine cursed David by his gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Philistine said to David, Come to me, and I will give thy flesh unto the fowls of the heaven, and to the beasts of the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said David to the Philistine, Thou comest to me with a sword, and with a spear, and with a shield, but I come to thee in the Name of the Lord of hosts, the God of the host of Israel, whom thou hast railed upon.
speaker: Narrator

text: This day shall the Lord close thee in mine hand, and I shall smite thee, and take thine head from thee, and I will give the carcasses of the host of the Philistines this day unto the fowls of the heaven, and to the beasts of the earth, that all the world may know that Israel hath a God,
speaker: Narrator

text: And that all this assembly may know, that the Lord saveth not with sword nor with spear, (for the battle is the Lord’s) and he will give you into our hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Philistine arose to come and draw near unto David, David hasted and ran to fight against the Philistine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David put his hand in his bag, and took out a stone, and slang it, and smote the Philistine in his forehead, that the stone sticked in his forehead, and he fell groveling to the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David overcame the Philistine with a sling and with a stone, and smote the Philistine, and slew him, when David had no sword in his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David ran, and stood upon the Philistine, and took his sword and drew it out of his sheath, and slew him, and cut off his head therewith. So when the Philistines saw that their champion was dead, they fled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men of Israel and Judah arose, and shouted, and followed after the Philistines, until they came to the valley, and unto the gates of Ekron: and the Philistines fell down wounded by the way of Shaaraim, even to Gath and to Ekron.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel returned from pursuing the Philistines, and spoiled their tents.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David took the head of the Philistine, and brought it to Jerusalem, and put his armor in his tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Saul saw David go forth against the Philistine, he said unto Abner the captain of his host, Abner, whose son is this young man? and Abner answered, As thy soul liveth, O king, I cannot tell.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the King said, Inquire thou whose son this young man is.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when David was returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, then Abner took him and brought him before Saul with the head of the Philistine in his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul said to him, Whose son art thou, thou young man? And David answered, I am the son of thy servant Jesse the Bethlehemite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had made an end of speaking unto Saul, the soul of Jonathan was knit with the soul of David, and Jonathan loved him, as his own soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul took him that day, and would not let him return to his father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jonathan and David made a covenant: for he loved him as his own soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jonathan put off the robe that was upon him, and gave it David, and his garments, even to his sword, and to his bow, and to his girdle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David went out whithersoever Saul sent him, and behaved himself wisely: so that Saul set him over the men of war, and he was accepted in the sight of all the people, and also in the sight of Saul’s servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came again, and David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, the women came out of all cities of Israel singing and dancing to meet king Saul, with timbrels, with instruments of joy, and with rebecks.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the women sang by course in their play, and said, Saul hath slain his thousand, and David his ten thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Saul was exceedingly wroth, and the saying displeased him, and he said, They have ascribed unto David ten thousand, and to me they have ascribed but a thousand, and what can he have more save the kingdom?
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore Saul had an eye on David from that day forward.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the morrow, the evil spirit of God came upon Saul, and he prophesied in the midst of the house: and David played with his hand like as at other times, and there was a spear in Saul’s hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul took the spear, and said, I will smite David through to the wall. But David avoided twice out of his presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul was afraid of David, because the Lord was with him, and was departed from Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Saul put him from him, and made him a captain over a thousand, and he went out and in before the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David behaved himself wisely in all his ways: for the Lord was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore when Saul saw that he was very wise, he was afraid of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all Israel and Judah loved David, because he went out and in before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Saul said to David, Behold mine eldest daughter Merab, her I will give thee to wife: only be a valiant son unto me, and fight the Lord’s battles: for Saul thought, Mine hand shall not be upon him, but the hand of the Philistines shall be upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David answered Saul, What am I? and what is my life, or the family of my father in Israel, that I should be son-in-law to the King?
speaker: Narrator

text: Howbeit when Merab Saul’s daughter should have been given to David, she was given unto Adriel a Meholathite to wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Michal Saul’s daughter loved David: and they showed Saul, and the thing pleased him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Saul said, I will give him her, that she may be a snare to him, and that the hand of the Philistines may be against him. Wherefore Saul said to David, Thou shalt this day be my son-in-law in the one of the twain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul commanded his servants, Speak with David secretly, and say, Behold, the king hath a favor to thee, and all his servants love thee: be now therefore the King’s son-in-law.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul’s servants spake these words in the ears of David. And David said, Seemeth it to you a light thing to be a king’s son-in-law, seeing that I am a poor man and of small reputation?
speaker: Narrator

text: And then Saul’s servants brought him word again, saying, Such words spake David.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul said, This wise shall ye say to David, The king desireth no dowry, but an hundred foreskins of the Philistines, to be avenged of the King’s enemies: for Saul thought to make David fall into the hands of the Philistines.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when his servants told David these words, it pleased David well, to be the King’s son-in-law: and the days were not expired.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward David arose with his men, and went and slew of the Philistines two hundred men: and David brought their foreskins, and they gave them wholly to the King that he might be the King’s son-in-law: therefore Saul gave him Michal his daughter to wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Saul saw, and understood that the Lord was with David, and that Michal the daughter of Saul loved him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Saul was more and more afraid of David, and Saul became always David’s enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Princes of the Philistines went forth, at their going forth David behaved himself more wisely than all the servants of Saul, so that his name was much set by.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Saul spake to Jonathan his son, and to all his servants, that they should kill David: but Jonathan Saul’s son had a great favor to David.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jonathan told David, saying, Saul my father goeth about to slay thee: now therefore, I pray thee, take heed unto thyself unto the morning, and abide in a secret place, and hide thyself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will go out and stand by my father in the field where thou art, and will commune with my father of thee, and I will see what he saith, and will tell thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jonathan spake good of David unto Saul his father, and said unto him, Let not the king sin against his servant, against David: for he hath not sinned against thee, but his works have been to thee very good.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he did put his life in danger, and slew the Philistine, and the Lord wrought a great salvation for all Israel: thou sawest it, and thou rejoicedst: wherefore then wilt thou sin against innocent blood, and slay David without a cause?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Saul hearkened unto the voice of Jonathan, and Saul swore, As the Lord liveth, he shall not die.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jonathan called David, and Jonathan showed him all those words, and Jonathan brought David to Saul, and he was in his presence as in times past.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again the war began, and David went out and fought with the Philistines, and slew them with a great slaughter, and they fled from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the evil spirit of the Lord was upon Saul, as he sat in his house having his spear in his hand, and David played with his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul intended to smite David to the wall with the spear: but he turned aside out of Saul’s presence, and he smote the spear against the wall: but David fled, and escaped the same night.
speaker: Narrator

text: Saul also sent messengers unto David’s house, to watch him, and to slay him in the morning: and Michal David’s wife told it him, saying, If thou save not thyself this night, tomorrow thou shalt be slain.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Michal let David down through a window: and he went, and fled, and escaped.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Michal took an image, and laid it in the bed, and put a pillow stuffed with goat’s hair under the head of it, and covered it with a cloth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Saul sent messengers to take David, she said, He is sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul sent the messengers again to see David, saying, Bring him to me in the bed, that I may slay him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the messengers were come in, behold, an image was in the bed with a pillow of goat’s hair under the head of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul said unto Michal, Why hast thou mocked me so, and sent away mine enemy, that he is escaped? And Michal answered Saul, He said unto me, Let me go, or else I will kill thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David fled, and escaped, and came to Samuel to Ramah, and told him all that Saul had done to him: and he and Samuel went and dwelt in Naioth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But one told Saul, saying, Behold, David is at Naioth in Ramah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul sent messengers to take David, and when they saw a company of Prophets prophesying, and Samuel standing as appointed over them, the Spirit of God fell upon the messengers of Saul, and they also prophesied.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when it was told Saul, he sent other messengers, and they prophesied likewise: again Saul sent the third messengers, and they prophesied also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then went he himself to Ramah, and came to a great well that is in Sechu, and he asked, and said, Where are Samuel and David? And one said, Behold, they be at Naioth in Ramah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went thither, even to Naioth in Ramah, and the Spirit of God came upon him also, and he went prophesying until he came to Naioth in Ramah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he stripped off his clothes, and he prophesied also before Samuel, and fell down naked all that day and all that night: therefore they say, Is Saul also among the Prophets?
speaker: Narrator

text: And David fled from Naioth in Ramah, and came and said before Jonathan, What have I done? what is mine iniquity? and what sin have I committed before thy father, that he seeketh my life?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto him, God forbid, thou shalt not die: behold, my father will do nothing great nor small, but he will show it me: and why should my father hide this thing from me? he will not do it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David swore again and said, Thy father knoweth that I have found grace in thine eyes: therefore he thinketh, Jonathan shall not know it, lest he be sorry: but indeed, as the Lord liveth, and as thy soul liveth, there is but a step between me and death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Jonathan unto David, Whatsoever thy soul requireth, that I will do unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said unto Jonathan, Behold, tomorrow is the first day of the month, and I should sit with the king at meat: but let me go, that I may hide myself in the fields unto the third day at even.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thy father make mention of me, then say, David asked leave of me, that he might go to Bethlehem to his own city: for there is a yearly sacrifice for all that family.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if he say thus, It is well, thy servant shall have peace: but if he be angry, be sure that wickedness is concluded of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shalt thou show mercy unto thy servant: for thou hast joined thy servant into a covenant of the Lord with thee, and if there be in me iniquity, slay thou me? for why shouldest thou bring me to thy father?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jonathan answered, God keep that from thee: for if I knew that wickedness were concluded of my father to come upon thee, would not I tell it thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said David to Jonathan, Who shall tell me? how shall I know, if thy father answer thee cruelly?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jonathan said to David, Come and let us go out into the field: and they twain went out into the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jonathan said to David, O Lord God of Israel, when I have groped my father’s mind tomorrow at this time, or within this three days, and if it be well with David, and I then send not unto thee, and show it thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord do so and much more unto Jonathan: but if my father have mind to do thee evil, I will show thee also, and send thee away, that thou mayest go in peace: and the Lord be with thee as he hath been with my father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise I require not whiles I live: for I doubt not but thou wilt show me the mercy of the Lord, that I die not.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I require that thou cut not off thy mercy from mine house forever: no, not when the Lord hath destroyed the enemies of David, every one from the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jonathan made a bond with the house of David, saying, Let the Lord require it at the hands of David’s enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: And again Jonathan swore unto David, because he loved him (for he loved him as his own soul,)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Jonathan to him, Tomorrow is the first day of the month: and thou shalt be looked for, for thy place shall be empty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thou shalt hide thyself three days, then thou shalt go down quickly and come to the place where thou didst hide thyself, when this matter was in hand, and shalt remain by the stone Ezel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will shoot three arrows on the side thereof, as though I shot at a mark.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after I will send a boy, saying, Go, seek the arrows. If I say unto the boy, See, the arrows are on this side thee, bring them, and come thou: for it is well with thee, and no hurt, as the Lord liveth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if I say thus unto the boy, Behold, the arrows are beyond thee, go thy way: for the Lord hath sent thee away.
speaker: Narrator

text: As touching the thing which thou and I have spoken of, behold, the Lord be between thee and me forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David hid himself in the field: and when the first day of the month came, the king sat to eat meat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king sat, as at other times upon his seat, even upon his seat by the wall: and Jonathan arose, and Abner sat by Saul’s side, but David’s place was empty.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul said nothing that day: for he thought, Something hath befallen him, though he were clean, or else because he was not purified.
speaker: Narrator

text: But on the morrow which was the second day of the month, David’s place was empty again: and Saul said unto Jonathan his son, Wherefore cometh not the son of Jesse to meat, neither yesterday nor today?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jonathan answered unto Saul, David required of me, that he might go to Bethlehem.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he said, Let me go, I pray thee: for our family offereth a sacrifice in the city, and my brother hath sent for me: therefore now, if I have found favor in thine eyes, let me go, I pray thee, and see my brethren: this is the cause that he cometh not unto the king’s table.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then was Saul angry with Jonathan, and said unto him, Thou son of the wicked rebellious woman, do not I know, that thou hast chosen the son of Jesse to thy confusion, and to the confusion and shame of thy mother?
speaker: Narrator

text: For as long as the son of Jesse liveth upon the earth, thou shalt not be established, nor thy kingdom: wherefore now send and fet him unto me, for he shall surely die.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jonathan answered unto Saul his father, and said unto him, Wherefore shall he die? what hath he done?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul cast a spear at him to hit him, whereby Jonathan knew, that it was determined of his father to slay David.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jonathan arose from the table in a great anger, and did eat no meat the second day of the month: for he was sorry for David, and because his father had reviled him.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the next morning therefore Jonathan went out into the field, at the time appointed with David, and a little boy with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto his boy, Run now, seek the arrows which I shoot, and as the boy ran, he shot an arrow beyond him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the boy was come to the place where the arrow was that Jonathan had shot, Jonathan cried after the boy, and said, Is not the arrow beyond thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jonathan cried after the boy, Make speed, haste and stand not still: and Jonathan’s boy gathered up the arrows, and came to his master,
speaker: Narrator

text: But the boy knew nothing: only Jonathan and David knew the matter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jonathan gave his bow and arrows unto the boy that was with him, and said unto him, Go, carry them into the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: As soon as the boy was gone, David arose out of a place that was toward the South, and fell on his face to the ground, and bowed himself three times: and they kissed one another, and wept both twain, till David exceeded.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Jonathan said to David, Go in peace: that which we have sworn both of us in the name of the Lord, saying, The Lord be between me and thee, and between my seed and between thy seed, let it stand forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he arose and departed, and Jonathan went into the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came David to Nob, to Ahimelech the Priest, and Ahimelech was astonied at the meeting of David, and said unto him, Why art thou alone, and no man with thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said to Ahimelech the Priest, The King hath commanded me a certain thing, and hath said unto me, Let no man know whereabout I send thee, and what I have commanded thee: and I have appointed my servants to such and such places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore if thou hast ought under thine hand, give me five cakes of bread, or what cometh to hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Priest answered David, and said, There is no common bread under mine hand, but here is hallowed bread, if the young men have kept themselves, at least from women.
speaker: Narrator

text: David then answered the Priest, and said unto him, Certainly women have been separate from us these two or three days since I came out: and the vessels of the young men were holy, though the way were profane, and how much more then shall every one be sanctified this day in the vessel?
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Priest gave him hallowed bread: for there was no bread there, save the showbread that was taken from before the Lord, to put hot bread there, the day that it was taken away.
speaker: Narrator

text: (And there was the same day one of the servants of Saul abiding before the Lord, named Doeg the Edomite, the chiefest of Saul’s herdmen.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said unto Ahimelech, Is there not here under thine hand a spear or a sword? for I have neither brought my sword nor mine harness with me, because the king’s business required haste.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Priest said, The sword of Goliath the Philistine, whom thou slewest in the valley of Elah, behold, it is wrapped in a cloth behind the Ephod: if thou wilt take that to thee, take it: for there is none other save that here: And David said, There is none to that, give it me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David arose and fled the same day from the presence of Saul, and went to Achish the king of Gath.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the servants of Achish said unto him, Is not this David the King of the land? did they not sing unto him in dances, saying, Saul hath slain his thousand, and David his ten thousand?
speaker: Narrator

text: And David considered these words, and was sore afraid of Achish the king of Gath.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he changed his behavior before them, and feigned himself mad in their hands, and scrabbled on the doors of the gate, and let his spittle fall down upon his beard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Achish unto his servants, Lo, ye see the man is beside himself, wherefore have ye brought him to me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Have I need of mad men, that ye have brought this fellow to play the mad man in my presence? shall he come into mine house?
speaker: Narrator

text: David therefore departed thence, and saved himself in the cave of Adullam: and when his brethren and all his father’s house heard it, they went down thither to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there gathered unto him all men that were in trouble, and all men that were in debt, and all those that were vexed in mind, and he was their prince, and there were with him about four hundred men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David went thence to Mizpah in Moab, and said unto the King of Moab, I pray thee, let my father and my mother come and abide with you, till I know what God will do for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he brought them before the King of Moab, and they dwelt with him all the while that David was in the hold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Prophet Gad said unto David, Abide not in the hold, but depart and go into the land of Judah. Then David departed and came into the forest of Hereth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul heard that David was discovered, and the men that were with him, and Saul remained in Gibeah under a tree in Ramah, having his spear in his hand, and all his servants stood about him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul said unto his servants that stood about him, Hear now, the sons of Benjamin, will the son of Jesse give every one of you fields and vineyards: will he make you all captains over thousands, and captains over hundreds:
speaker: Narrator

text: That all ye have conspired against me, and there is none that telleth me that my son hath made a covenant with the son of Jesse? and there is none of you that is sorry for me, or showeth me, that my son hath stirred up my servant to lie in wait against me, as appeareth this day?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then answered Doeg the Edomite, (who was appointed over the servants of Saul) and said, I saw the son of Jesse, when he came to Nob, to Ahimelech the son of Ahitub,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who asked counsel of the Lord for him, and gave him victuals, and he gave him also the sword of Goliath the Philistine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the King sent to call Ahimelech the Priest the son of Ahitub, and all his father’s house, to wit, the Priests that were in Nob: and they came all to the King.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul said, Hear now thou son of Ahitub. And he answered, Here I am, my lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Saul said unto him, Why have ye conspired against me, thou and the son of Jesse, in that thou hast given him victual, and a sword, and hast asked counsel of God for him, that he should rise against me, and lie in wait as appeareth this day?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ahimelech answered the King, and said, Who is so faithful among all thy servants as David, being also the king’s son-in-law, and goeth at thy commandment, and is honorable in thine house?
speaker: Narrator

text: Have I this day first begun to ask counsel of God for him? be it far from me, let not the king impute anything unto his servant, nor to all the house of my father: for thy servant knew nothing of all this, less nor more.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the King said, Thou shalt surely die, Ahimelech, thou, and all thy father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the King said unto the sergeants that stood about him, Turn, and slay the Priests of the Lord, because their hand also is with David, and because they knew when he fled, and showed it not unto me. But the servants of the King would not move their hands to fall upon the Priests of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the King said to Doeg, Turn thou and fall upon the Priests. And Doeg the Edomite turned, and ran upon the Priests, and slew that same day fourscore and five persons, that did wear a linen Ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Nob the city of the Priests smote he with the edge of the sword, both man and woman, both child and suckling, both ox and ass, and sheep with the edge of the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: But one of the sons of Ahimelech the son of Ahitub (whose name was Abiathar) escaped and fled after David.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abiathar showed David, that Saul had slain the Lord’s Priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said unto Abiathar, I knew it the same day, when Doeg the Edomite was there, that he would tell Saul. I am the cause of the death of all the persons of thy father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abide thou with me, and fear not: for he that seeketh my life, shall seek thy life also: for with me thou shalt be in safeguard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they told David, saying, Behold, the Philistines fight against Keilah, and spoil the barns.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore David asked counsel of the Lord, saying, Shall I go and smite these Philistines? And the Lord answered David, Go and smite the Philistines, and save Keilah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David’s men said unto him, See, we be afraid here in Judah, how much more if we come to Keilah against the host of the Philistines?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David asked counsel of the Lord again. And the Lord answered him, and said, Arise, go down to Keilah: for I will deliver the Philistines into thine hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David and his men went to Keilah, and fought with the Philistines, and brought away their cattle, and smote them with a great slaughter: thus David saved the inhabitants of Keilah.
speaker: Narrator

text: (And when Abiathar the son of Ahimelech fled to David to Keilah, he brought an Ephod with him.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was told Saul that David was come to Keilah, and Saul said, God hath delivered him into mine hand: for he is shut in, seeing he is come into a city that hath gates and bars.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Saul called all the people together to war for to go down to Keilah, and to besiege David and his men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David having knowledge that Saul imagined mischief against him, said to Abiathar the Priest, Bring the Ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said David, O Lord God of Israel, thy servant hath heard, that Saul is about to come to Keilah to destroy the city for my sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Will the lords of Keilah deliver me up into his hand? and will Saul come down, as thy servant hath heard? O Lord God of Israel, I beseech thee, tell thy servant. And the Lord said, He will come down.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said David, Will the lords of Keilah deliver me up, and the men that are with me, into the hand of Saul? And the Lord said, They will deliver thee up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David and his men, which were about six hundred, arose and departed out of Keilah, and went whither they could. And it was told Saul, that David was fled from Keilah, and he left off his journey.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David abode in the wilderness in the holds, and remained in a mountain in the wilderness of Ziph. And Saul sought him every day, but God delivered him not into his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David saw that Saul was come out for to seek his life: and David was in the wilderness of Ziph in the wood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jonathan Saul’s son arose and went to David into the wood, and comforted him in God,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said unto him, Fear not: for the hand of Saul my father shall not find thee, and thou shalt be king over Israel, and I shall be next unto thee: and also Saul my father knoweth it.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they twain made a covenant before the Lord: and David did remain in the wood: but Jonathan went to his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came up the Ziphites to Saul to Gibeah, saying, Doth not David hide himself by us in holds, in the wood in the hill of Hachilah, which is on the right side of Jeshimon?
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, O king, come down according to all that thine heart can desire, and our part shall be to deliver him into the King’s hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Saul said, Be ye blessed of the Lord: for ye have had compassion on me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go, I pray you, and prepare ye yet better: know and see his place where he haunteth, and who hath seen him there: for it is said to me, He is subtle, and crafty.
speaker: Narrator

text: See therefore and know all the secret places where he hideth himself, and come ye again to me with the certainty, and I will go with you: and if he be in the land, I will search him out throughout all the thousands of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they arose and went to Ziph before Saul, but David and his men were in the wilderness of Maon, in the plain on the right hand of Jeshimon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Saul also and his men went to seek him, and they told David: wherefore he came down unto a rock, and abode in the wilderness of Maon. And when Saul heard that, he followed after David in the wilderness of Maon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul and his men went on the one side of the mountain: and David and his men on the other side of the mountain: and David made haste to get from the presence of Saul: for Saul and his men compassed David and his men round about, to take them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But there came a messenger to Saul, saying, Haste thee, and come: for the Philistines have invaded the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore Saul returned from pursuing David, and went against the Philistines. Therefore they called that place, Sela Hammahlekoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David went thence, and dwelt in holds at En Gedi.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Saul was turned from the Philistines, they told him, saying, Behold, David is in the wilderness of En Gedi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Saul took three thousand chosen men out of all Israel, and went to seek David and his men upon the rocks among the wild goats.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he came to the sheepcotes by the way where there was a cave, and Saul went in to do his easement: and David and his men sat in the inward parts of the cave.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men of David said unto him, See, the day is come, whereof the Lord said unto thee, Behold, I will deliver thine enemy into thine hand, and thou shalt do to him as it shall seem good to thee. Then David arose and cut off the lap of Saul’s garment privily.
speaker: Narrator

text: And afterward David was touched in his heart, because he had cut off the lap which was on Saul’s garment.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto his men, The Lord keep me from doing that thing unto my master the Lord’s anointed, to lay mine hand upon him: for he is the Anointed of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David overcame his servants with these words, and suffered them not to arise against Saul: for Saul rose up out of the cave and went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: David also arose afterward, and went out of the cave, and cried after Saul, saying, O my lord the King. And when Saul looked behind him, David inclined his face to the earth, and bowed himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said to Saul, Wherefore givest thou an ear to men’s words, that say, Behold, David seeketh evil against thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, this day thine eyes have seen, that the Lord had delivered thee this day into mine hand in the cave, and some bade me kill thee, but I had compassion on thee, and said, I will not lay mine hand on my master: for he is the Lord’s Anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover my father, behold: behold, I say, the lap of thy garment in mine hand: for when I cut off the lap of thy garment, I killed thee not. Understand and see, that there is neither evil nor wickedness in me, neither have I sinned against thee, yet thou huntest after my soul, to take it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord be judge between thee and me, and the Lord avenge me of thee, and let not mine hand be upon thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: According as the old proverb saith, Wickedness proceedeth from the wicked, but mine hand be not upon thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: After whom is the king of Israel come out? after whom dost thou pursue? after a dead dog, and after a flea?
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord therefore be judge, and judge between thee and me, and see, and plead my cause, and deliver me out of thine hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: When David had made an end of speaking these words to Saul, Saul said, Is this thy voice, my son David? and Saul lift up his voice, and wept,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said to David, Thou art more righteous than I: for thou hast rendered me good, and I have rendered thee evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou hast showed this day, that thou hast dealt well with me: forasmuch as when the Lord had closed me in thine hands, thou killedst me not.
speaker: Narrator

text: For who shall find his enemy, and let him depart free? wherefore the Lord render thee good for that thou hast done unto me this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: For now behold, I know that thou shalt be king, and that the kingdom of Israel shall be stablished in thine hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Swear now therefore unto me by the Lord, that thou wilt not destroy my seed after me, and that thou wilt not abolish my name out of my father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David swore unto Saul, and Saul went home: but David and his men went up unto the hold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Samuel died, and all Israel assembled, and mourned for him, and buried him in his own house at Ramah. And David arose and went down to the wilderness of Paran.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in Maon was a man, who had his possession in Carmel, and the man was exceeding mighty, and had three thousand sheep, and a thousand goats, and he was shearing his sheep in Carmel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The name also of the man was Nabal, and the name of his wife Abigail, and she was a woman of singular wisdom, and beautiful, but the man was churlish, and evil conditioned, and was of the family of Caleb.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David heard in the wilderness, that Nabal did shear his sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore David sent ten young men, and David said unto the young men, Go up to Carmel, and go to Nabal, and ask him in my name how he doeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thus shall ye say for salutation, Both thou, and thine house, and all that thou hast, be in peace, wealth and prosperity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have heard, that thou hast shearers: now thy shepherds were with us, and we did them no hurt, neither did they miss anything all the while they were in Carmel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ask thy servants, and they will show thee. Wherefore let these young men find favor in thine eyes: (for we come in a good season) give, I pray thee, whatsoever cometh to thine hand unto thy servants, and to thy son David.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when David’s young men came, they told Nabal all those words in the name of David, and held their peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Nabal answered David’s servants, and said, Who is David? and who is the son of Jesse? there be many servants nowadays, that break away every man from his master.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall I then take my bread, and my water, and my flesh that I have killed for my shearers, and give it unto men, whom I know not whence they be?
speaker: Narrator

text: So David’s servants turned their way, and went again, and came and told him all those things.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said unto his men, Gird every man his sword about him. And they girded every man his sword: David also girded his sword. And about four hundred men went up after David, and two hundred abode by the carriage.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now one of the servants told Abigail Nabal’s wife, saying, Behold, David sent messengers out of the wilderness to salute our master, and he railed on them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding, the men were very good unto us, and we had no displeasure, neither missed we anything as long as we were conversant with them, when we were in the fields.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were as a wall unto us both by night and by day, all the while we were with them keeping sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore take heed, and see what thou shalt do: for evil will surely come upon our master, and upon all his family: for he is so wicked, that a man cannot speak to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Abigail made haste, and took two hundred cakes, and two bottles of wine, and five sheep ready dressed, and five measures of parched corn, and an hundred frails of raisins, and two hundred of figs, and laid them on asses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then she said unto her servants, Go ye before me: behold, I will come after you: yet she told not her husband Nabal.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as she rode on her ass, she came down by a secret place of the mountain, and behold, David and his men came down against her, and she met them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said, Indeed I have kept all in vain that this fellow had in the wilderness, so that nothing was missed of all that pertained unto him: for he hath requited me evil for good.
speaker: Narrator

text: So and more also do God unto the enemies of David: for surely I will not leave of all that he hath by the dawning of the day, any that pisseth against the wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Abigail saw David, she hasted and lighted off her ass, and fell before David on her face, and bowed herself to the ground,
speaker: Narrator

text: And fell at his feet, and said, Oh, my lord, I have committed the iniquity, and I pray thee, let thine handmaid speak to thee, and hear thou the words of thine handmaid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not my lord, I pray thee, regard this wicked man, Nabal: for as his name is, so is he: Nabal is his name, and folly is with him: but I thine handmaid saw not the young men of my lord whom thou sentest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore my lord, as the Lord liveth, and as thy soul liveth (the Lord, I say, that hath withholden thee from coming to shed blood, and that thine hand should not save thee) so now thine enemies shall be as Nabal, and they that intend to do my lord evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now this blessing which thine handmaid hath brought unto my lord, let it be given unto the young men, that follow my lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray thee, forgive the trespass of thine handmaid: for the Lord will make my lord a sure house, because my lord fighteth the battles of the Lord, and none evil hath been found in thee in all thy life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet a man hath risen up to persecute thee, and to seek thy soul, but the soul of my lord shall be bound in the bundle of life with the Lord thy God: and the soul of thine enemies shall God cast out, as out of the middle of a sling.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Lord shall have done to my lord all the good that he hath promised thee, and shall have made thee ruler over Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall it be no grief unto thee, nor offence of mind unto my lord, that he hath not shed blood causeless, nor that my lord hath not preserved himself: and when the Lord shall have dealt well with my lord, remember thine handmaid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David said to Abigail, Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, which sent thee this day to meet me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And blessed be thy counsel, and blessed be thou, which hast kept me this day from coming to shed blood, and that mine hand hath not saved me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For indeed, as the Lord God of Israel liveth, who hath kept me back from hurting thee, except thou hadst hasted and met me, surely there had not been left unto Nabal by the dawning of the day, any that pisseth against the wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David received of her hand that which she had brought him, and said to her, Go up in peace to thine house: behold, I have heard thy voice, and have granted thy petition.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Abigail came to Nabal, and behold, he made a feast in his house, like the feast of a king, and Nabal’s heart was merry within him, for he was very drunken: wherefore she told him nothing, neither less nor more, until the morning arose.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then in the morning, when the wine was gone out of Nabal, his wife told him those words, and his heart died within him, and he was like a stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: And about ten days after, the Lord smote Nabal, that he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when David heard that Nabal was dead, he said, Blessed be the Lord, that hath judged the cause of my rebuke of the hand of Nabal, and hath kept his servant from evil: for the Lord hath recompensed the wickedness of Nabal upon his own head. Also David sent to commune with Abigail, to take her to his wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the servants of David were come to Abigail to Carmel, they spake unto her, saying, David sent us to thee, to take thee to his wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she arose, and bowed herself on her face to the earth, and said, Behold, let thine handmaid be a servant to wash the feet of the servants of my lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abigail hasted, and arose, and rode upon an ass, and her five maids followed her, and she went after the messengers of David, and was his wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: David also took Ahinoam of Jezreel, and they were both his wives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Saul had given Michal his daughter, David’s wife, to Palti the son of Laish, which was of Gallim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again the Ziphites came unto Saul to Gibeah, saying, Doth not David hide himself in the hill of Hachilah before Jeshimon?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Saul arose, and went down to the wilderness of Ziph, having three thousand chosen men of Israel with him, for to seek David in the wilderness of Ziph.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul pitched in the hill of Hachilah, which is before Jeshimon by the wayside. Now David abode in the wilderness, and he saw that Saul came after him into the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For David had sent out spies, and understood that Saul was come in very deed.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David arose, and came to the place where Saul had pitched, and when David beheld the place where Saul lay, and Abner the son of Ner which was his chief captain, (for Saul lay in the fort, and the people pitched round about him.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then spake David, and said to Ahimelech the Hittite, and to Abishai the son of Zeruiah, brother to Joab, saying, Who will go down with me to Saul to the host? Then Abishai said, I will go down with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David and Abishai came down to the people by night: and behold, Saul lay sleeping within the fort, and his spear did stick in the ground at his head: and Abner and the people lay round about him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Abishai to David, God hath closed thine enemy into thine hand this day: now therefore, I pray thee, let me smite him once with a spear to the earth, and I will not smite him again.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said to Abishai, Destroy him not: for who can lay his hand on the Lord’s anointed, and be guiltless?
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover David said, As the Lord liveth, either the Lord shall smite him, or his day shall come to die, or he shall descend into battle, and perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord keep me from laying mine hand upon the Lord’s anointed: but, I pray thee, take now the spear that is at his head, and the pot of water, and let us go hence.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David took the spear and the pot of water from Saul’s head, and they got them away, and no man saw it, nor marked it, neither did any awake, but they were all asleep: for the Lord had sent a dead sleep upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David went unto the other side, and stood on the top of an hill a far off, a great space being between them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David cried to the people, and to Abner the son of Ner, saying, Hearest thou not, Abner? Then Abner answered, and said, Who art thou that cryest to the King?
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said to Abner, Art not thou a man? and who is like thee in Israel? wherefore then hast thou not kept thy Lord the King? for there came one of the folk in to destroy the king thy lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is not well done of thee: as the Lord liveth, ye are worthy to die, because ye have not kept your master the Lord’s anointed: and now see where the King’s spear is, and the pot of water that was at his head.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul knew David’s voice, and said, Is this thy voice, my son David? And David said, It is my voice, my lord, O King.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Wherefore doth my lord thus persecute his servant? for what have I done? or what evil is in mine hand?
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, I beseech thee, let my Lord the King hear the words of his servant. If the Lord have stirred thee up against me, let him smell the savor of a sacrifice: but if the children of men have done it, cursed be they before the Lord: for they have cast me out this day from abiding in the inheritance of the Lord, saying, Go, serve other gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, let not my blood fall to the earth before the face of the Lord: for the King of Israel is come out to seek a flea, as one would hunt a partridge in the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Saul, I have sinned: Come again, my son David: for I will do thee no more harm, because my soul was precious in thine eyes this day: behold, I have done foolishly, and have erred exceedingly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David answered, and said, Behold the King’s spear, let one of the young men come over and fet it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let the Lord reward every man according to his righteousness and faithfulness: for the Lord had delivered thee into mine hands this day, but I would not lay mine hand upon the Lord’s anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, like as thy life was much set by this day in mine eyes: so let my life be set by in the eyes of the Lord, that he may deliver me out of all tribulation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Saul said to David, Blessed art thou, my son David: for thou shalt do great things, and also prevail. So David went his way, and Saul returned to his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said in his heart, I shall now perish one day by the hand of Saul: is it not better for me that I save myself in the land of the Philistines, and that Saul may have no hope of me to seek me anymore in all the coasts of Israel, and so escape out of his hand?
speaker: Narrator

text: David therefore arose, and he, and the six hundred men that were with him, went unto Achish the son of Maoch king of Gath.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David dwelt with Achish at Gath, he, and his men, every man with his household, David with his two wives, Ahinoam the Jezreelite, and Abigail Nabal’s wife the Carmelite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was told Saul that David was fled to Gath: so he sought no more for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said unto Achish, If I have now found grace in thine eyes, let them give me a place in some other city of the country, that I may dwell there: for why should thy servant dwell in the head city of the kingdom with thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Achish gave him Ziklag that same day: therefore Ziklag pertaineth unto the kings of Judah unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the time that David dwelt in the country of the Philistines, was four months and certain days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David and his men went up, and invaded the Geshurites, and the Girzites, and the Amalekites: for they inhabited the land from the beginning, from the way, as thou goest to Shur, even unto the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David smote the land, and left neither man nor woman alive, and took sheep, and oxen, and asses, and camels, and apparel, and returned and came to Achish.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Achish said, Where have ye been a roving this day? And David answered, Against the South of Judah, and against the South of the Jerahmeelites, and against the South of the Kenites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David saved neither man nor woman alive, to bring them to Gath, saying, Lest they should tell on us, and say, So did David, and so will be his manner all the while that he dwelleth in the country of the Philistines.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Achish believed David, saying, He hath made his people of Israel utterly to abhor him: therefore he shall be my servant forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now at that time the Philistines assembled their bands and army to fight with Israel: therefore Achish said to David, Be sure, thou shalt go out with me to the battle, thou, and thy men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said to Achish, Surely thou shalt know what thy servant can do. And Achish said to David, Surely I will make thee keeper of mine head forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Samuel was then dead, and all Israel had lamented him, and buried him in Ramah his own city: and Saul had put away the sorcerers, and the Soothsayers out of the land.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Philistines assembled themselves, and came and pitched in Shunem: and Saul assembled all Israel, and they pitched in Gilboa.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Saul saw the host of the Philistines, he was afraid, and his heart was sore astonied.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Saul asked counsel of the Lord, and the Lord answered him not, neither by dreams, nor by Urim, nor yet by Prophets.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Saul unto his servants, Seek me a woman that hath a familiar spirit, that I may go to her, and ask of her. And his servants said to him, Behold, there is a woman at En Dor that hath a familiar spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Saul changed himself, and put on other raiment, and he went, and two men with him, and they came to the woman by night: and he said, I pray thee, conjecture unto me by the familiar spirit, and bring me him up whom I shall name unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the woman said unto him, Behold, thou knowest what Saul hath done, how he hath destroyed the sorcerers, and the soothsayers out of the land: wherefore then seekest thou to take me in a snare to cause me to die?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Saul swore to her by the Lord, saying, As the Lord liveth, no harm shall come to thee for this thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said the woman, Whom shall I bring up unto thee? And he answered, Bring me up Samuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the woman saw Samuel, she cried with a loud voice, and the woman spake to Saul, saying, Why hast thou deceived me? for thou art Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king said unto her, Be not afraid: for what sawest thou? And the woman said unto Saul, I saw gods ascending up out of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said unto her, What fashion is he of? And she answered, An old man cometh up lapped in a mantel: and Saul knew that it was Samuel, and he inclined his face to the ground, and bowed himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Samuel said to Saul, Why hast thou disquieted me, to bring me up? Then Saul answered, I am in great distress: for the Philistines make war against me, and God is departed from me, and answereth me no more, neither by Prophets, neither by dreams: therefore I have called thee, that thou mayest tell me, what I shall do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Samuel, Wherefore then dost thou ask of me, seeing, the Lord is gone from thee, and is thine enemy?
speaker: Narrator

text: Even the Lord hath done to him, as he spake by mine hand: for the Lord will rent the kingdom out of thine hand, and give it thy neighbor David.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because thou obeyedst not the voice of the Lord, nor executedst his fierce wrath upon the Amalekites, therefore hath the Lord done this unto thee this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the Lord will deliver Israel with thee into the hands of the Philistines: and tomorrow shalt thou and thy sons be with me, and the Lord shall give the host of Israel into the hands of the Philistines.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Saul fell straightway all along on the earth, and was sore afraid because of the words of Samuel, so that there was no strength in him: for he had eaten no bread all the day nor all the night.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the woman came unto Saul, and saw that he was sore troubled, and said unto him, See, thine handmaid hath obeyed thy voice, and I have put my soul in mine hand, and have obeyed thy words which thou saidest unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, I pray thee, hearken thou also unto the voice of thine handmaid, and let me set a morsel of bread before thee, that thou mayest eat and get thee strength, and go on thy journey.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he refused and said, I will not eat: but his servants and the woman together compelled him, and he obeyed their voice: so he arose from the earth, and sat on the bed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the woman had a fat calf in the house, and she hasted, and killed it, and took flour, and kneaded it, and baked of it unleavened bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then she brought them before Saul, and before his servants: and when they had eaten, they stood up, and went away the same night.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Philistines were gathered together with all their armies in Aphek: and the Israelites pitched by the fountain, which is in Jezreel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the princes of the Philistines went forth by hundreds and thousands, but David and his men came behind with Achish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said the Princes of the Philistines, What do these Hebrews here? And Achish said unto the princes of the Philistines, Is not this David the servant of Saul the King of Israel, who hath been with me these days, or these years, and I have found nothing in him, since he dwelt with me unto this day?
speaker: Narrator

text: But the princes of the Philistines were wroth with him, and the princes of the Philistines said unto him, Send this fellow back, that he may go again to his place which thou hast appointed him, and let him not go down with us to battle, lest that in the battle he be an adversary to us: for wherewith should he obtain the favor of his master? should it not be with the heads of these men?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is not this David, of whom they sang in dances, saying, Saul slew his thousand, and David his ten thousand?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Achish called David, and said unto him, As the Lord liveth, thou hast been upright and good in my sight, when thou wentest out and in with me in the host, neither have I found evil with thee, since thou camest to me unto this day, but the princes do not favor thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore now return, and go in peace, that thou displease not the princes of the Philistines.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said unto Achish, But what have I done? and what hast thou found in thy servant as long as I have been with thee unto this day, that I may not go and fight against the enemies of my Lord the King?
speaker: Narrator

text: Achish then answered and said to David, I know thou pleasest me as an Angel of God: but the princes of the Philistines have said, Let him not go up with us to battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore now rise up early in the morning with thy master’s servants that are come with thee: and when ye be up early, as soon as ye have light, depart.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David and his men rose up early to depart in the morning, and to return into the land of the Philistines: and the Philistines went up to Jezreel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when David and his men were come to Ziklag the third day, the Amalekites had invaded upon the South, even unto Ziklag, and had smitten Ziklag, and burnt it with fire,
speaker: Narrator

text: And had taken the women that were therein, prisoners, both small and great, and slew not a man, but carried them away, and went their ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David and his men came to the city, and behold, it was burnt with fire, and their wives and their sons, and their daughters were taken prisoners.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David and the people that were with him, lift up their voices and wept, until they could weep no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: David’s two wives were taken prisoners also, Ahinoam the Jezreelite, and Abigail the wife of Nabal the Carmelite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David was in great sorrow: for the people intended to stone him, because the hearts of all the people were vexed every man for his sons and for his daughters: but David comforted himself in the Lord his God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said to Abiathar the Priest Ahimelech’s son, I pray thee, bring me the Ephod. And Abiathar brought the Ephod to David.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David asked counsel of the Lord, saying, Shall I follow after this company? shall I overtake them? And he answered him, Follow: for thou shalt surely overtake them, and recover all.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David and the six hundred men that were with him, went, and came to the river Besor, where a part of them abode:
speaker: Narrator

text: But David and four hundred men followed (for two hundred abode behind, being too weary to go over the river Besor.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And they found an Egyptian in the field, and brought him to David, and gave him bread, and he did eat, and they gave him water to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also they gave him a few figs, and two clusters of raisins: and when he had eaten, his spirit came again to him: for he had eaten no bread, nor drunk any water in three days, and three nights.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said unto him, To whom belongest thou? and whence art thou? And he said, I am a young man of Egypt, and servant to an Amalekite: and my master left me three days ago because I fell sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: We roved upon the South of Chereth, and upon the coast belonging to Judah, and upon the South of Caleb, and we burnt Ziklag with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David said unto him, Canst thou bring me to this company? And he said, Swear unto me by God, that thou will neither kill me, nor deliver me into the hands of my master, and I will bring thee to this company.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had brought him thither, behold, they lay scattered abroad upon all the earth, eating and drinking, and dancing, because of all the great prey that they had taken out of the land of the Philistines, and out of the land of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David smote them from the twilight even unto the evening of the next morrow, so that there escaped not a man of them, save four hundred young men, which rode upon camels, and fled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David recovered all that the Amalekites had taken: also David rescued his two wives.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they lacked nothing, small or great, son or daughter, or of the spoil of all that they had taken away: David recovered them all.
speaker: Narrator

text: David also took all the sheep, and the oxen, and they drove them before his cattle, and said, This is David’s prey.
speaker: Narrator

text: And David came to the two hundred men that were too weary for to follow David: whom they had made also to abide at the river Besor: and they came to meet David, and to meet the people that were with him: so when David came near to the people, he saluted them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then answered all the evil and wicked of the men that went with David, and said, Because they went not with us, therefore will we give them none of the prey that we have recovered, save to every man his wife and his children: therefore let them carry them away and depart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said David, Ye shall not do so, my brethren, with that which the Lord hath given us, who hath preserved us, and delivered the company that came against us, into our hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: For who will obey you in this matter? but as his part is that goeth down to the battle, so shall his part be, that tarrieth by the stuff: they shall part alike.
speaker: Narrator

text: So from that day forward he made it a statute and a law in Israel, until this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: When David therefore came to Ziklag, he sent of the prey unto the Elders of Judah and to his friends, saying, See there is a blessing for you of the spoil of the enemies of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent to them of Bethel, and to them of South Ramoth, and to them of Jattir,
speaker: Narrator

text: And to them of Aroer, and to them of Siphmoth, and to them of Eshtemoa,
speaker: Narrator

text: And to them of Rachal, and to them of the cities of the Jerahmeelites, and to them of the cities of the Kenites,
speaker: Narrator

text: And to them of Hormah, and to them of Chorashan, and to them of Athach,
speaker: Narrator

text: And to them of Hebron, and to all the places where David and his men had haunted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Philistines fought against Israel, and the men of Israel fled away from the Philistines, and they fell down wounded in mount Gilboa.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Philistines pressed sore upon Saul and his sons, and slew Jonathan, and Abinadab, and Malchishua Saul’s sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the battle went sore against Saul, the archers and bowmen hit him, and he was sore wounded of the archers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Saul unto his armor bearer, Draw out thy sword, and thrust me through therewith, lest the uncircumcised come and thrust me through and mock me: but his armor bearer would not, for he was sore afraid. Therefore Saul took a sword and fell upon it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when his armor bearer saw that Saul was dead, he fell likewise upon his sword, and died with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Saul died, and his three sons, and his armor bearer, and all his men that same day together.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the men of Israel that were on the other side of the valley, and they of the other side Jordan saw that the men of Israel were put to flight, and that Saul and his sons were dead, then they left the cities, and ran away: and the Philistines came and dwelt in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the morrow when the Philistines were come to spoil them that were slain, they found Saul and his three sons lying in mount Gilboa,
speaker: Narrator

text: And they cut off his head, and stripped him out of his armor, and sent into the land of the Philistines on every side, that they should publish it in the temple of their idols, and among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they laid up his armor in the house of Ashtoreth, but they hanged up his body on the wall of Beth Shan.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the inhabitants of Jabesh Gilead heard what the Philistines had done to Saul,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they arose (as many as were strong men) and went all night, and took the body of Saul, and the bodies of his sons, from the wall of Beth Shan, and came to Jabesh, and burnt them there,
speaker: Narrator

text: And took their bones and buried them under a tree at Jabesh, and fasted seven days.
speaker: Narrator
